item.title: Longitudinal Regression Trees
item.description:
Work with Anna Neufeld (initially as an Honors project) to review and compare existing methods to create a regression tree based on longitudinal quantitative outcome data and then improving the methodology to be able to detect additive and interactive relationships between baseline covariates and growth patterns.

Product

  • splinetree R package is available on CRAN to implement this work.

item.title: Vertically shifted Growth Mixture Models
item.description:
Coming out of my dissertation work, I developed a methodological study of mixture models for longitudinal data and their ability to detect growth patterns. In this paper, I showed that the default model assumptions do not necessarily create groups that are homogenous in terms of growth pattern over time as they seek to explain the most variation, whether it be from the overall level or pattern over time. I suggested a pre-processing step that removes the outcome level to explicitly focus on the shape.

Product:

  • Heggeseth, B. C. and Jewell, N. P. (2018), “How Gaussian mixture models might miss detecting factors that impact growth patterns,” Annals of Applied Statistics, 12(1): 222-245.
